page.title: 01THE BACK DISTRICT
page.content:
The{Back District}of the Isle of Lewis consists of the villages of{Back, Coll {and Gress.}
These villages lie on improved grass- land between the rough interior moor- land and the area of sea known as {Broad Bay,}once a noted haddock fish- ing ground, but now depleted.
The surveyed area has 328 houses, and is primarily a crofting community, but few inhabitants make their full living in this way.
The Back District is highly dependent for shopping facilities and employment on the town of{Stornoway}which is 7 miles away.
